definition: glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
surname Zuo
left/the Left (politics)/east/unorthodox/queer/wrong/differing/opposite/variant of 佐[zuo3]
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
to hope for/to long for/to expect

sentences.english: However, So many men do not stop grazing round.
sentences.chinese: 但是很多男人并没结束自己左顾右盼的心理和行为。

sentences.english: While crossing the street, he looked right and left, afraid that he might run into some passing car.
sentences.chinese: 他穿过马路时，左顾右盼，害怕撞到过路的车子上。

sentences.english: While crossing the street , he looked right and left, afraid that he might run into some passing car.
sentences.chinese: 他穿过公路时，左顾右盼，害怕撞到过路的车子上。

sentences.english: There is no talking or glancing right and left during the test.
sentences.chinese: 考试进行时，不准谈话或左顾右盼。

sentences.english: The sharp-eyed knight glance left and right under, obviously have already lost a square inch.
sentences.chinese: 锐眼骑士左顾右盼之下，显然已经失去了方寸。

sentences.english: That guy is very suspicious, his shifty eyes move constantly.
sentences.chinese: 那个人十分可疑，瞪着贼眼左顾右盼的。

sentences.english: They looked neither left nor right, just focused on the helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 他们丝毫没有左顾右盼，一直朝着直升机走去。

sentences.english: I glance left and right, see every where nobody, noodles Lou fierce light.
sentences.chinese: 我左顾右盼，见四下没人，就面露凶光。

definition: to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
to look around
to pace/to stroll
everywhere
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to draw back/to move back and forth/to hesitate/in an instant
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
sneaky/furtive
absent-minded/preoccupied/inattentive/with one's thoughts wandering
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
very slow
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
